definition: to rub/to grind/to polish/to sharpen/to wear down/to die out/to waste time/to pester/to insist
to decrease/to lose/to damage/to harm/(coll.) to speak sarcastically/to deride/caustic/mean/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷨)

sentences.english: The friction coefficient is measured by ball on disc rubbing test, and the wear rates are also calculated.
sentences.chinese: 採用球盤磨損試驗測試摩擦係數，並計算出比磨損率。

sentences.english: Current has obviously affected on wear rate compared with loading.
sentences.chinese: 在試驗範圍內，電流比載荷對磨損率的影響顯著。

sentences.english: This material is possessed of some advantages such as good frictional properties, reliable bra-keage, and low wear rate etc.
sentences.chinese: 它具有較好的摩擦性能，制動可靠，磨損率低等優點。
